misdeed: A series of unsettling events has befallen a village: livestock are found slaughtered, their bodies drained of blood; people report feeling watched, a cold dread gripping their hearts; and strange, bird-like shapes are seen circling in the night sky.
solution: The Vaesen are Night Ravens and can be banished by finding their original bodies and burying them in consecrated ground.

clues.description: Witnesses describe seeing flocks of unusually large ravens with an oily, almost ethereal quality, their eyes glowing with an eerie red light.
The attacks seem to occur most frequently during significant religious holidays, as if the creatures mock the sanctity of the occasions.
The air grows heavy and oppressive as night falls, accompanied by an unsettling silence broken only by the occasional, bloodcurdling shriek.
Black feathers, strangely weightless and cold to the touch, are found scattered near the sites of the attacks.
A local historian discovers records of a plague that ravaged the village centuries ago, the victims hastily buried in a mass grave outside the consecrated graveyard.
The village priest notices that the holy water font in the church has turned cloudy and foul, as if tainted by an unholy presence.

plotTwist.description: A graverobber, seeking valuables buried with the dead, has unwittingly disturbed the Vaesen's resting place, unleashing them upon the village.
